reviews.text:
Rubbish station honestly. Limited number of ticket machines, no lifts to give easy step free access between platforms and it's rather inconvenient that the district line only runs on weekends. I'd gladly accept a 15 minute shuttle to/from High Street Kensington with it.

Also trains here are prone to delay, cancellations and overcrowding to a ridiculous degree. It's honestly shocking that TFL could look at these services and consider it acceptable. Avoid.

29.07.2019 9.50 pm Me and my paralysed wife are both in wheelchairs. We travelled in Overground from Stratford to Kensington Olympia and we did not get help. We could get out only thanks to the passengers. Shame TFL.
Nice and simple station and gets me where I need to be

Customer service needs huge improvements and of course its great to build system to travel not just for walking people, Wheelchairs need to have access also, Kensington (Olympia) is a combined rail and tube station between Kensington and West Kensington on the boundary of west and central London. It is managed and served by London Overground and served by Southern and London Underground. It is in Travelcard Zone 2. On the Underground it is the terminus of a short District line branch, built as part of the Middle Circle, from Earl's Court; on the main-line railway it is on the West London Line from Clapham Junction to Willesden Junction, by which many trains bypass Central London. The station's name is drawn from its location in Kensington and the adjacent Olympia exhibition centre.
Best train station i have ever seen in London. This is infront of Olympia Exhibition center
